thread.title: "The only time in history I'm happy that Spurs won" - Arsenal fans react to Spurs ending Chelsea's run
thread.title_full: "The only time in history I'm happy that Spurs won" - Arsenal fans react to Spurs ending Chelsea's run

author: Mark Jones
title: "The only time in history I'm happy that Spurs won" - Arsenal fans react to Spurs ending Chelsea's run
text:
Spurs did the business, and for once Arsenal fans didn't mind (Photo: Clive Rose) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It was always going to be a strange night for Arsenal fans. 
On the one hand stood the prospect of falling behind their North London rivals Tottenham in the table, and on the other was the possibly of slipping 11 points back in the title race and seeing Chelsea equal their 14-match unbeaten run set in 2002. 
In the event, the idea of Chelsea losing seemed to be the one which caught those Gooners' imaginations the most, and so most were pretty happy that Antonio Conte's side went down 2-0 . 
It's just that, well, it was Spurs that won. They were never going to willingly express that happiness. Scenes which were repeated in Arsenal fans' living rooms across the world, maybe (Photo: Chelsea Football Club) 
Fans didn't really know what to think, as was evidenced by some of these tweets. 
And so with confusion reigning around North London, maybe its best that Arsenal fans just forget all of this happened? 
It was all a dream, don't worry. Like us on Facebook
